trans-unit.source: Provides untyped access to grouped ASP.NET profile property values.

The <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileGroupBase> class is used by ASP.NET to create grouped properties in the <xref:System.Web.HttpContext.Profile%2A> property for the current <xref:System.Web.HttpContext>.

When properties are specified as a group of properties using the [group Element for properties for profile (ASP.NET Settings Schema)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/b4e3672f-9653-4034-a178-fb358b02730e), ASP.NET creates a new class with strongly typed accessors for each property in the group.
The new class inherits the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileGroupBase> base class.

The strongly typed accessors of the new class call the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileGroupBase.GetPropertyValue%2A> and <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileGroupBase.SetPropertyValue%2A> methods of the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileGroupBase> base class to retrieve and set profile property values, respectively.

The <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileGroupBase> passes calls to get and set property values to the class that inherits the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileBase> class that is supplied to the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileGroupBase.Init%2A> method of the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileGroupBase> class.
See the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileBase> class for more information on behaviors, exceptions, and so on.
This class is not intended to be created from your code.
Creates an instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Profile.ProfileGroupBase"></xref> class.
ASP.NET uses the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileGroupBase> class to create grouped properties in the <xref:System.Web.HttpContext.Profile%2A> property for the current <xref:System.Web.HttpContext>.

When properties are specified as a group of properties using the [group Element for properties for profile (ASP.NET Settings Schema)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/b4e3672f-9653-4034-a178-fb358b02730e) element, ASP.NET creates a new class with strongly typed accessors for each property in the group.
The new class inherits the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileGroupBase> base class.
This class is not intended to be created from your code.
Gets the value of a grouped profile property.
ASP.NET uses the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileBase> class to create the class for the user profile.
When an application that has the user profile enabled is started, ASP.NET creates a new class of type `ProfileCommon`, which inherits from the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileBase> class.

Strongly typed accessors are added to the `ProfileCommon` class for each group and property defined in the [profile Element (ASP.NET Settings Schema)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/ccb9bf3a-a044-464d-b89b-5cb5a3d389dd) configuration section.

The strongly typed accessors of the `ProfileCommon` class call the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileGroupBase.GetPropertyValue%2A> method to retrieve untyped values from the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileProvider> that the generated accessor then casts as the specified type and returns as the grouped property value.
You can use the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileGroupBase.GetPropertyValue%2A> method to retrieve grouped property values of the user profile for your application by name.
Returned values are typed as `object` and must be cast as the specific object type when retrieved.

For strongly typed access to profile property values, you can access the grouped property by name as a member of a group of the <xref:System.Web.HttpContext.Profile%2A> property, for example, `Profile.Address.City`.
The name of the grouped profile property.
The value of the grouped profile property typed as `object`.
Used by ASP.NET to initialize the grouped profile property values and information.
This method is not intended to be used from your code.
The class that inherits <xref href="System.Web.Profile.ProfileBase"></xref> that is assigned to the <xref href="System.Web.HttpContext.Profile"></xref> property.
The name of the profile property group.
Gets or sets a grouped profile property value indexed by the property name.
You can use this property to retrieve or set grouped property values of the user profile for your application.
Returned values are typed as <xref:System.Object> and must be cast as the specific object type when retrieved.

For strongly typed access to profile property values, you can access the property by name as a member of a group of the <xref:System.Web.HttpContext.Profile%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property, for example, `Profile.Address.City`.
The name of the grouped profile property.
The value of the specified grouped profile property.
Sets the value of a grouped profile property.
ASP.NET uses the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileBase> class to create the class used for the user profile.
When an application that has the user profile enabled is started, ASP.NET creates a new class of type `ProfileCommon`, which inherits from the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileBase> class.

Strongly typed accessors are added to the `ProfileCommon` class for each group and property defined in the [profile Element (ASP.NET Settings Schema)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/ccb9bf3a-a044-464d-b89b-5cb5a3d389dd) configuration section.

The strongly typed accessors of the `ProfileCommon` class call the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileGroupBase.SetPropertyValue%2A> method to pass grouped property values to the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileProvider> to be stored at the data source.
You can use the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileGroupBase.SetPropertyValue%2A> method to assign values to grouped properties of the user profile for your application by name.
Values are typed as `object,` and type checking will be done at run time, not compile time.

For strongly typed access to profile property values, you can access the grouped property by name as a member of a group of the <xref:System.Web.HttpContext.Profile%2A> property, for example, `Profile.Address.City`.
The name of the grouped property to set.
The value to assign to the grouped property.
